name: alopecia
description: Loss of hair from the scalp or body

name: altered calcium concentration
description: Abnormal levels of calcium in the blood

name: altered phosphorus concentration
description: Abnormal levels of phosphorus in the blood

name: anhidrosis
description: Inability to sweat normally

name: basal cell carcinoma in children
description: A type of skin cancer occurring in children's basal cells

name: brittle hair
description: Hair that is prone to breakage

name: caf√©-au-lait spots
description: Flat, pigmented birthmarks

name: cherry-red spot
description: A red spot seen in the central retina

name: corneal abnormality
description: Any defect or disorder affecting the cornea

name: cutis laxa
description: Rare connective tissue disorder with loose skin

name: diabetes insipidus
description: Condition characterized by frequent urination and thirst

name: diffuse peritoneal thickening
description: Widespread thickening of the peritoneal lining

name: ectodermal dysplasia
description: Group of disorders affecting the ectodermal structures

name: eczema
description: Inflammatory condition causing itchy, red skin

name: fingertip calcification
description: Calcium deposits in the fingertips

name: goiter
description: Enlargement of the thyroid gland

name: hair color abnormality
description: Alteration in normal hair pigment

name: hirsutism
description: Excessive body hair in a male-pattern distribution in women

name: hydatid disease
description: Parasitic infection caused by Echinococcus granulosus

name: hypercalcemia
description: Condition of having high calcium levels in the blood

name: hypercalciuria
description: Excessive levels of calcium in the urine.

name: hyperhidrosis
description: Excessive sweating.

name: hyperkeratosis
description: Thickening of the keratin layer of the skin.

name: hyperparathyroidism
description: Overactivity of one or more of the parathyroid glands leading to an excess of parathyroid hormone.

name: hyperphosphatasemia
description: Elevated levels of alkaline phosphatase in the blood.

name: hyperphosphatemia
description: High levels of phosphate in the blood.

name: hyperpituitarism
description: Excess hormone secretion from the anterior pituitary gland.

name: hypocalcemia
description: Low level of calcium in the blood.

name: hypoglycemia
description: Abnormally low blood sugar levels.

name: hypohidrosis
description: Reduced ability to sweat.

name: hypokalemia
description: Low potassium levels in the blood.

name: hypoparathyroidism
description: Decreased function of the parathyroid glands leading to low parathyroid hormone levels.

name: hypophosphatemia
description: Low levels of phosphate in the blood.

name: hypopituitarism
description: Reduced hormone secretion from the pituitary gland.

name: ichthyosis
description: Family of skin disorders characterized by dry, scaly skin.

name: immune disorder
description: Disorders that impair the immune system function.

name: lipoatrophy
description: Localized loss of fat tissue.

name: low hairline
description: Hairline starts lower on the forehead than average.

name: mitochondrial disorder
description: Genetic disorders affecting the mitochondria's function.

name: nail aplasia
description: Absence or underdevelopment of nails.

name: nail deformity
description: Abnormal shape or structure of the nail.

name: nail discoloration
description: Abnormal color of the nail, varying from normal pigmentation.

name: nail dystrophy
description: Disorder of nail development and growth.

name: nail hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment or incomplete development of the nails.

name: neurocutaneous syndrome
description: Genetic disorders affecting both skin and nervous system.

name: nipple anomaly
description: Abnormal feature or growth concerning the nipple.

name: onycholysis
description: Separation of the nail from the nail bed at the distal end.

name: pancytopenia
description: Reduction of all blood cell types: red, white, and platelets.

name: polycythemia
description: Condition characterized by increased red blood cells.

name: predominantly ectodermal phakomatosis
description: Disorders affecting ectodermal derived tissues notably skin and nervous system.

name: predominantly endodermal phakomatosis
description: Disorders affecting endodermal derived tissues, often associated with other syndromes.

name: predominantly mesodermal phakomatosis
description: Disorders affecting mesodermal derived tissues including vascular systems.

name: premature aging
description: Appearance or condition of being older than chronological age.

name: pterygium
description: Fibrous proliferation in conjunctiva commonly extending to cornea.

name: skin aplasia
description: Congenital absence of skin in localized or extensive areas.

name: skin atrophy
description: Thinning or loss of skin layer and elasticity.

name: skin calcification
description: Deposition of calcium salts in skin, appearing as hardened areas.

name: skin dimple
description: Small indentation or depression in the skin surface.

name: skin hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the skin, often congenital.

name: skin neoplasm
description: Abnormal growth of tissue in the skin, benign or malignant.

name: skin photosensitivity
description: Increased sensitivity of the skin to sunlight.

name: skin pigment abnormality
description: Alterations in the normal pigmentation of the skin.

name: skin rash
description: An area of irritated or swollen skin.

name: skin tag
description: A small, benign growth on the skin.

name: soft-tissue calcification
description: Deposition of calcium in soft tissues.

name: thrombocythemia
description: A condition characterized by an excessive number of platelets in the blood.

name: wrinkled skin
description: Formation of small ridges and furrows on the skin.
